required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Irritation Potential of Omeza Collagen Matrix Using Modified HRIPT
clinical_study.official_title: A 6-Week, Randomized, Evaluator-Blinded, In Vivo Within Subject Repeat Test to Evaluate the Irritation and Sensitization Potential of Omeza Collagen Matrix in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study was to assess the sensitization potential of Omeza Collagen Matrix compared to that of a negative control based on a Modified Human Repeat Insult Patch Test.

study_design_info.masking_description: The trained skin evaluator and Investigator was blinded to the identity of the test materials. Test/control sites were randomized within participants.

primary_outcome.description: Rated on a numeric scale from 0 - 3 (0: No visible reaction, +: Slight/patchy, 1: Mild, 2: Moderate, 3: Strong)

Subjects had a rest period of 10-17 days, followed by challenge applications of each investigational product to naive sites for approximately 48 hours. Evaluation of response was measure by rating skin irritancy/erythema on a scale of 0-3

Subjects had a rest period of 10-17 days, followed by challenge applications of each investigational product to naive sites for approximately 48 hours. Evaluation of response was measure by rating skin irritancy/erythema on a scale of 0-3

Subjects had a rest period of 10-17 days, followed by challenge applications of each investigational product to naive sites for approximately 48 hours. Evaluation of response was measure by rating skin irritancy/erythema on a scale of 0-3

Subjects had a rest period of 10-17 days, followed by challenge applications of each investigational product to naive sites for approximately 48 hours. Evaluation of response was measure by rating skin irritancy/erythema on a scale of 0-3

intervention.description: Occlusive Patch of 0.9% sodium chloride, NaCl
